Its flowing tones endure for billions of eons without cease, its scripture renewed after ten thousand kalpas. Without a golden tablet or jade name, none may partake of its teachings.

Later disciples who diligently aspire to lofty heights, casting off burdens and forgetting the dust, calming their hearts and fostering constancy, facing the dawn clouds and morning radiance, purifying their essence and enduring hardship in devotion—even if weary, they dare not sleep. Their seven ancestral generations shall bear the burden of Mount Meng’s stones, filling the River of Night. They shall never attain immortality.

Jade is carved into writs, gold is forged into tablets, inscribed with vermilion script and bound with purple cords. They are perpetually shaded by dark clouds and purple canopies in their chambers, while the hundred harmonies’ incense perfumes their courtyards. Three hundred Jade Maidens of the Western Florescence and three hundred Lads of the Golden Dawn are appointed to guard the numinous scripture.

Those who are earnest and endure hardship are commanded to receive this scripture in mystery, presenting their names to the Jade Emperor of the Three Origins and the Eastern Florescence. The Most High shall dispatch Perfected Ones to transmit the true scripture to them. Later sages and all Perfected Ones must first present tablets to the Eastern Florescence and submit jade writs to the Upper Clarity before they may receive the *Scripture of the Great Cavern*. Therefore, I now transmit the precepts of the Supreme August Emperor, compiling and arranging them to open a ford for later disciples. To the High Minister of the Grand Clarity, the Jade Treasure of the Golden Portal, the Master of the Lofty Dawn, and the Azure Lad of the Eastern Sea: Jia, by virtue of past karmic blessings, has been filled with felicity in later generations. Through the cultivation of a true master, he has received the supreme scriptures. Reverently presenting this golden tablet, he records his name in the Azure Palace, beseeching that he be granted enrollment and that the Jade Youth be entrusted with his record. May this be universally proclaimed to all heavens and earths, the Caverns of Clarity, Depth, and Origin, and the immortals of the Five Peaks. May all witness this separate decree, and may true numina descend, allowing him to ride the flying clouds and ascend to the Three Clarities.

Upon completion, rise and bow twice.

After presenting the tablets on all three sides, turn again to the east, click the teeth nine times, and recite the incantation:

The primal net stretches into the distant, the celestial Perfected dwell in the hidden. By the blessings of former lives, felicity extends to this rebirth. Through the karmic bond with a true master, the precious scriptures were faithfully transmitted. Daring to inform the Three Origins, I present this memorial to the Jade Clarity. Inscribed in gold for the Eastern Florescence, my name is recorded in the immortal registers. May I forever be a servant of the Emperor, and may true numina descend. Grant me Jade Youths and Jade Maidens to guard my form, that I may ride the flying clouds, ascend to the Golden Portal, and prostrate before the Jade Court.

Upon completion, swallow the saliva nine times and cease.

After all is done, bury the tablets at the affiliated peak, with the Jade Emperor’s tablet to the north, the Three Origins’ tablet to the west, and the Azure Palace’s tablet to the east, three feet deep into the earth, and firmly tamp the soil above.

Upon completion of the burial, prostrate facing north, click the teeth nine times, and recite the incantation:

My name is memorialized in the Jade Register, my record inscribed in the Upper Clarity. Golden tablets and jade missives compose this imperial missive. The lofty and distant, the Three Origins and the hidden—true officials descend. Reverently, I invoke the numinous. Sealing the tablets in the sacred peak, the memorial is presented to the Three Clarities, listed in the Eastern Florescence, and my jade name is recorded. May I ride the mysterious chariot, the flying clouds and green carriage, ascending to the Three Origins, my body soaring to the Imperial Dawn.

Upon completion, rise and bow twice.

The method of presenting tablets to seek immortality, as received by the Celestial King of Primordial Beginning from the Most High, requires three presentations of tablets and missives. Within nine years, the Jade Emperor will bestow cinnabar essence, jade mushrooms, dragon seals, and phoenix insignia. The Perfected of the Supreme Ultimate will descend to your chamber, and the Three Origins will dispatch thirty-six Jade Youths and Jade Maidens. The High Minister Azure Lad will inform the Five Peaks and grant you the office of immortal, along with a canopy of flying clouds, to welcome your body’s ascent to the Palace of the Golden Portal.

This precious and secret text of the Most High is not transmitted to the world. It is entrusted to the High Minister Azure Lad for safekeeping, to verify the registers of true immortals and transmit it to those destined to become Perfected Ones. If one’s bone and qi are suitable, or if one seeks with utmost sincerity and devotion, moved by the Upper Clarity, and beholds this text, their name shall be retroactively recorded in the Azure Palace. Following the statutes and presenting the tablets, they shall become a Perfected One.

The Most High has assigned thirty-six Jade Maidens of the Western Florescence to attend and guard the sacred text, recording merits and manifesting virtue. If you possess this text, you must constantly burn incense, pay reverence, and recite it as if serving a sovereign or father. The divine and numinous will naturally descend and appear in your chamber.

Those who violate the statutes or reveal it carelessly shall perish and be consigned to the offices of ghosts, eternally confined in hell, never attaining immortality. Be warned and cautious.

Those who study immortality but lack this text may not recklessly recite the thirty-nine chapters of the *Jade Clarity’s Precious Scriptures*. Whenever the Jade Scriptures are chanted, they shake the Nine Heavens, and all Celestial Kings prostrate themselves to listen. Their resonance is lofty and far-reaching, their power not insignificant. On the day of recitation, the Azure Lad of the Eastern Florescence, leading the immortals, shall verify the jade names. Those who have presented golden tablets shall be universally proclaimed to all heavens, earths, and the Three Realms, and all shall come to their domain to bow in reverence. Those without a jade name or golden missive who recite the thirty-nine chapters shall disturb the Most High, and the officials shall be dispatched to restrain them.

Those who recklessly invoke the sacred scriptures shall lose their spirit and essence, their minds and natures become disordered, their emotions unstable, shifting between anger and joy. Among countless scholars, not one in ten thousand achieves Perfection. Though they seek diligently, few avoid failure midway. Some grow lax, others become resentful, cursing and reviling, striking gods and ghosts, or slandering sacred texts, doubting their authenticity. Some leak precious secrets, exposing them to the world. All this stems from the Eastern Florescence lacking their golden name, so they are not praised by the Three Realms and are instead assailed by demonic forces, failing in every trial—a sign of impending death. Thus, the thirty-nine chapters may not be recklessly recited.

Those who obtain this scripture should pay reverence, purify themselves, and cultivate it with devotion. Do not recite it carelessly. Over time, you will naturally receive golden tablets and jade missives.

**Presenting Golden Tablets to the Upper Register at the Azure Palace of the Eastern Florescence**

All who study the Dao and achieve Perfection as true immortals must first journey to the Azure Palace of the Eastern Florescence in the Land of Square Cauldrons to present tablets and pay homage to the Azure Lad. The Eastern Florescence has six gates, each encompassing a circuit of three thousand li.

The Eastern Gate is named the Gate of Azure Florescence, guarded by Gatekeeper Qiu Boyuan, who oversees the registers of immortal studies.

The Southern Gate is named the Gate of Divine Florescence and Jade, guarded by Gatekeeper Yu Zusi, who oversees the comings and goings of true immortals and divine transcendents.

chunks.original_text: 西门名玉洞门，门郎姓庾，名尚节，主高上众真玉皇、三十九帝、二十四玉真、西龟王母所出入。 北门名玉阴门，门郎姓史，名少华，主真仙及始学者，犯纠退降所经。 东南门名天关，门郎姓名，名五车，主人宿命因缘簿录，得仙所由。 东北门名寒水门，门郎姓童，名林都，主鬼爽转叙所经。 右六门，治天东垄山，门有师子、巨狩各三百头，卫门侍门各三千守士。 学道之人，宜先知门名次第，有知者则为不死，名便得奏青宫。 然当入室烧香，常存念门名，及门郎姓字，九年，克得乘云升门也。 此道秘在玉宝宫内，有得知者，白日升天。 轻泄传付非真，长闭夜狱，终不得轻於东华青宫也。 门内有三宫： 第一宫名方诸青宫。 第二宫名玉宝青官。 第三宫名玉华青宫。 宫内有玉树数百株，上有鹍鹞、凤皇，九色之鸟，下有芝草、玉井，自生之泉，饮之寿同三光，师子、天兽附墙。 上相青童君，治在方诸青宫之内，金殿琼房之裹，众真侍女三千人侍卫左右，玄晖自映，神烛自明，青霞荫其上，紫霄绕其房。 宫内北殿上有金格，格上有玉格，格上有学仙簿录，及玄名年深深浅金简玉札，有十万篇，领仙玉郎典之，有知者白日升天。 玉宝王上相大司马高晨师，治王宝青紫宫，云绕其房，虚烟生其堂，自明神烛照其内，众仙玉女三千人侍卫左右。 宫内北殿上有金格，格上有金章凤玺玉札，丹青羽盖，升仙法服，以给成真之人。 又有学仙品目进叙及退降簿录，侍仙玉晨典之，有知者白日升天。 东海青华小童，治在玉华青宫，紫云盖其上，日月夹其宇，众仙玉女三千人侍卫左右。 宫内东殿玉格上，有宝经三百卷、玉诀九千篇，主学仙簿箓，应为真人者授之，玉晨监仙侍郎典〔之，有知〕#3者，白日升天。 东华青宫俯仰之格 青童君曰：凡学道求仙，宜知俯仰之格，有知者，其名便以逆注青宫。 当懃心苦念，入室烧香，存想六门三室之内，使分明罗列，便叩齿三通，仰咒曰： 上清玄晨，三宫六门，典我玉名，降我神真，龙裙羽章，以给我身，上升玉清，东华投篇，名刻金格，长为帝宾。 毕，咽炁九过止。 如此九年，克得真灵下降，玉女见形，玄云绿軿来迎子身。 凡修此道，不得履淹入秽，常当清斋念真，真无不降。 其法秘要，不得妄传，传非其人，殃及七玄，身被风刀之拷。 真人投简正仪 凡学道道成，皆先诣东华青宫投金简，更受仙号。 当至神华玉门，未至门，夹门有两玉阙，当伏阙左投简，须臾当报，便起进门下，又伏门左，须臾，当有四真人出引前，便起直进方诸青宫，伏於阶下。 临时自当有侍者唱赞，听唱便起再拜，真人引上殿上，当从南阶左行上，伏於殿前，须臾，当有领仙玉郎赍金简紫籍，来校定玉名，名参紫簿，即授玉札，更署真仙之号，上升玉清。 羽童丹青飞裙，金真玉光流金火铃，玉童玉女各三十六人，仙官三十六人。 受署毕，便起再拜，退还阶下，又再拜，至门止，又再拜，皆向宫也。 至时，自当有所主统，所治住止，游於五岳之仪格也。 此青宫旧格，未成真人者。 诣东华方诸青宫，上相青童君几前：某岳先生王甲，年如干岁，一名某，字甲，某月生。 右金简仪，书一简上。 此学道道成，上诣青官投金简，受署真仙上格。

**Western Gate** is named the Gate of Jade Grotto, guarded by Gatekeeper Yu Shangjie, who oversees the comings and goings of the Supreme Assembly of Perfected Ones—Jade Sovereign, the Thirty-Nine Emperors, the Twenty-Four Jade Perfected, and the Queen Mother of the Western Tortoise.

**Northern Gate** is named the Gate of Jade Shade, guarded by Gatekeeper Shi Shaohua, who oversees the registers of true immortals and beginning disciples, as well as those subject to reprimand, demotion, or expulsion.

**Southeastern Gate** is named the Gate of Heavenly Pass, guarded by Gatekeeper Wu Che, who oversees the ledgers of karmic causes and conditions, and the records of those who attain immortality.

**Northeastern Gate** is named the Gate of Cold Waters, guarded by Gatekeeper Tong Lindu, who oversees the registers of wandering spirits and their reincarnations.

These six gates govern the Eastern Mound Mountain. At each gate stand three hundred lions and colossal beasts, with three thousand guardian soldiers stationed as attendants. Those who study the Dao should first learn the names and order of these gates; those who know them shall not die, and their names may be presented to the Azure Palace.

Upon entering the chamber, one must burn incense and constantly visualize the names of the gates and their gatekeepers. After nine years of such practice, one may ascend through the gates upon clouds.

This Dao is secretly preserved within the Jade Treasure Palace. Those who attain this knowledge shall ascend to heaven in broad daylight. If lightly disclosed or transmitted to the unworthy, one shall be eternally confined to the Night Prison and never be permitted entry into the Azure Palace of the Eastern Florescence.

Within the gates lie three palaces:

The **First Palace** is named the Azure Palace of Square Cauldrons.
The **Second Palace** is named the Jade Treasure Azure Palace.
The **Third Palace** is named the Jade Florescence Azure Palace.

Within these palaces stand hundreds of jade trees, upon which perch kun-pengs and phoenixes, along with birds of nine colors. Below grow lingzhi herbs and jade wells, with springs that flow of their own accord. Those who drink from them shall enjoy a lifespan equal to the Three Luminaries. Lions and celestial beasts stand guard along the walls.

The **Upper Minister, Azure Lad**, governs within the Azure Palace of Square Cauldrons, dwelling in a golden hall with chambers of jasper. Three thousand Perfected Maidens attend him on either side. A radiance of dark splendor shines of itself, and divine candles illuminate the halls. Azure mists shade the palace above, while purple clouds encircle its chambers.

In the northern hall of the palace stands a golden register, upon which rests a jade register. Within lie the ledgers of immortal studies, the golden tablets and jade missives of those whose Dao-names have deepened or shallowed over time—numbering one hundred thousand in all. These are overseen by the Jade Lord of Immortal Records. Those who attain this knowledge shall ascend to heaven in broad daylight.

The **Upper Minister, Great Marshal Gao Chenshi**, governs within the Azure Purple Palace of the Jade Treasure. Clouds encircle its chambers, and ethereal mists arise within its halls. Divine candles illuminate its interiors of their own accord. Three thousand Perfected Maidens of Jade attend him on either side.

In the northern hall of the palace stands a golden register, upon which rest golden seals, phoenix insignia, jade missives, vermilion and azure feathered canopies, and the vestments of ascended immortals—bestowed upon those who attain Perfection. Also recorded here are the ranks of immortal studies, the ledgers of promotions and demotions, overseen by the Jade Dawn of Attendant Immortals. Those who attain this knowledge shall ascend to heaven in broad daylight.

The **Azure Florescence Lad of the Eastern Sea** governs within the Jade Florescence Azure Palace. Purple clouds shade its halls above, while the sun and moon flank its eaves. Three thousand Perfected Maidens of Jade attend him on either side.

In the eastern hall of the palace, upon a jade register, rest three hundred volumes of precious scriptures and nine thousand jade instructions. These govern the ledgers of immortal studies and are bestowed upon those destined to become Perfected Ones. They are overseen by the Jade Dawn of Attendant Immortals. Those who attain this knowledge shall ascend to heaven in broad daylight.

**The Protocol of Reverence and Posture at the Azure Palace of the Eastern Florescence**

The Azure Lad states: All who study the Dao and seek immortality should know the protocol of reverence and posture. Those who master it shall have their names inscribed in reverse order in the Azure Palace.

One must diligently focus the mind, enter the chamber, burn incense, and visualize the six gates and three palaces in vivid detail. Then, knock the teeth together three times and recite the following incantation while looking upward:

*"Supreme Clarity of the Mystic Dawn,
Three Palaces and Six Gates,
Inscribe my jade name,
Send down my divine Perfected Ones.
Dragon skirts and feathered regalia
Shall adorn my body.
Ascending to Jade Clarity,
Presenting my missive to the Eastern Florescence,
My name engraved upon the golden register,
I shall forever be a guest of the Emperor."*

Upon completion, swallow the qi nine times and cease.

After nine years of such practice, true spirits shall descend, Perfected Maidens shall appear, and clouds of dark radiance with green chariots shall come to welcome your body.

In cultivating this Dao, one must not tread upon defiled ground or enter impure places. One should constantly maintain purity, fast, and invoke the Perfected Ones—then the true shall unfailingly descend.

This method is secret and essential; it must not be lightly transmitted. If transmitted to the unworthy, calamity shall extend to the Seven Ancestors, and one’s body shall be subjected to the tortures of the Wind Blade.

**The Proper Rites for Presenting Golden Tablets**

All who study the Dao and attain Perfection must first journey to the Azure Palace of the Eastern Florescence to present golden tablets and receive their immortal titles.

Upon arriving at the Gate of Divine Florescence and Jade, before reaching the gate, one shall see two jade towers flanking it. Prostrate to the left of the towers and present the tablet. After a moment, a report shall be given; then rise and proceed to the gate, prostrating again to its left. After a moment, four Perfected Ones shall emerge to guide you forward. Rise and proceed directly to the Azure Palace of Square Cauldrons, prostrating at the base of the steps.

At the appointed time, an attendant shall chant the praises. Upon hearing the chant, rise and bow twice. The Perfected Ones shall lead you up the hall, ascending from the left of the southern steps. Prostrate before the hall, and after a moment, the Jade Lord of Immortal Records shall arrive bearing golden tablets and purple registers to verify your jade name. Once your name is confirmed in the purple ledger, you shall be granted a jade missive and bestowed a new title as a true immortal, ascending to Jade Clarity.

Thirty-six Feathered Lads in vermilion and azure, thirty-six Perfected Ones of Gold with flowing golden fire-bells, and thirty-six Jade Lads and Maidens—along with thirty-six Immortal Officials—shall be present.

Upon receiving the title, rise and bow twice, then retreat to the base of the steps and bow twice more. Proceed to the gate and bow twice again, always facing the palace.

At this time, you shall be assigned a governing office, a place of residence, and the protocols for roaming the Five Peaks.

This is the old protocol of the Azure Palace, observed by those who have not yet attained Perfection.

**Presenting at the Azure Palace of Square Cauldrons before the Upper Minister, the Azure Lad:**

[Your name], Master of [Your Peak], Wang [Your Surname], aged [Your Age], also named [Your Dao-name], styled [Your Style], born in the [X] month.

**Protocol for the Golden Tablet:**
Inscribe one tablet and present it above.

This is the rite for those who have attained the Dao, journeying to the Azure Palace to present golden tablets and receive their titles as true immortals of the Upper Register.

chunks.original_text: 上相藏於玉宝之宫，不传下世，若有得者，便是骨相合仙，名应玉格，自然亦得上升青宫也。 此法尤重，不得妄宣，有犯被拷三官，深宜慎之。 上清金阙宫俯仰之格 上清金阙宫在三元宫之北，相去五万里，高上所处之东，去玄羽野西垄山九千里，处玉清之西，与天关连台。 外有四门，门有两阙，一阙金，一阙玉，皆夹门左右。 门有羽衣守士各三百人，师子巨兽各三百首，内有清精玉芝流霞之泉。 东门名玉景金融门，门有二玉晨王，执九节之麾，各镇一半，高上玉清虚皇太真之宾，出入之所经。 南门名洞宝琼云门，主真人飞仙游宴八极，周行五岳，出入之所经。 西门名玄京玉宝门，主学仙受署真人，进叙录簿所由经也。 北门名朔阴极云门，主真人犯非退降偏皇之任，学素简所经由也。 凡有四门，门有两阙，金阙在左，玉阙在右，并高九千丈。 金阙以金为柱，紫云为盖，刻金题阙众真飞仙之号。 玉阙以青玉为柱，绿云为盖，刻玉题阙上皇太真之号。 八阙悉如是。 阙下则有青龙白虎，处在左右，天兽巨虬备卫玉阙，玉童玉女各三百人，散香其间。 阙上有九层金台，虚上玉晨领仙君所住。 门内周回七千里，金阙宫处在中央，中有金辉紫殿琼房玉室，后圣金阙帝君所住。 紫云荫其上，绿霞绕房，日月夹照，神烛自明，金真玉女，散香虚庭，流光八玄，风鼓玄旌，回舞旄盖，玉树激音，琳枝自籁，百响互生，此金阙之上馆，众真之所经。 其有四极真人，主领学仙传录，进叙退降，及始学仪则，皆由四极真人也。 真人奉玉札仪格 夫学道道成，皆诣东华青宫，校定金名，退更清斋三月，书玉札一枚，诣金阙谒金阙帝君。 仪法当於洞宝琼云门外，投玉札，伏地须臾，待报便起，再拜四极真人，当引入进金阙下。 又在金阙左、玉阙右伏地须臾，真人引进紫殿。 当从左行，绕玉景金融门，过东南行，上登殿下伏阶。 左领仙玉郎，以紫凤丹章、飞行玉情飞青羽盖、丹锦飞裙十绝龙幡，使登三元宫，流金火铃玉札金章，令召千灵流云玄霞九龙玉舆，受号真仙，飞行太空，侍唱仪则。 事毕，便起再拜，揖谢三过。 此受号而已，未得便见帝君。 毕，当直行，诣朔阴极云门金阙下，东向伏地称：游学先生王甲，今受帝君真仙之号，不胜喜庆，谨诣阙谢闻，乞丐虚上玉晨领仙君，记名玉阙，系在真仙之次。 起再拜，次诣玄京玉宝门金阙下，南向伏称如上法。 次诣洞宝琼云门金阙下，西向伏称如上法。 次诣玉景金融门金阙下，东向伏称如上法。 诣四门八阙毕，还从玉景金融门外，更再拜伏地，四极真人当赍金札玉章授其身，时自当有五岳仙官云车来迎也。 其时自当有所之方面，掌统灵岳之任也。 诣玉清金阙宫后圣帝君几前： 某岳先生臣王甲，年如干岁，字某甲。 右金简文，书一简上。 真人谒金阙投简受号上法，此学道道成，上诣金阙，谒金阙帝君，更受真仙之号。 拜谢仪则，帝君常所宝秘，以授成真人之者，不传下世。 有得金阙宫名，及金简仪则，此名逆注金格，亦自然得登金阙也。 金阙宫门名，此皆九天之隐名，於地上之音异。 故高上虚皇道君经易有，九天之上西北门，名易有，去玄京宝门三千五百里，然运明梁之炁，二门相通也。

The Upper Minister’s records are stored in the Palace of Jade Treasures, not transmitted to the lower world. Should one obtain them, it signifies that their bone-configuration aligns with immortality, their name corresponds to the Jade Register, and they shall naturally ascend to the Azure Palace. This method is especially solemn; it must not be rashly disclosed. Violators will be interrogated by the Three Officials—exercise utmost caution.

**Protocols for the Upper Clarity Golden Gates Palace**

The Upper Clarity Golden Gates Palace lies north of the Three Origins Palace, five myriad *li* distant. To the east of the Highest Abode, nine thousand *li* west of the Black Feather Wilds’ Western Ridge Mountain, it stands west of Jade Clarity, conjoined with the Celestial Pass. Four gates flank its exterior, each gate flanked by two towers—one golden, one jade—positioned to the left and right. At each gate stand three hundred feather-robed guardian officers and three hundred lion-headed colossal beasts. Within flow the Pure Essence Jade Mushroom and Flowing Rosy Mist Springs.

The Eastern Gate is named the Jade Radiance Golden Fusion Gate. Two Jade Dawn Kings, wielding nine-jointed banners, each guard one half. This is the passage through which the Highest Jade Clarity Void Sovereign’s perfected guests enter and exit.

The Southern Gate is named the Cavern Treasure Rosy Cloud Gate, through which perfected ones and flying immortals roam the Eight Poles, traverse the Five Peaks, and come and go.

The Western Gate is named the Mystic Capital Jade Treasure Gate, through which those studying immortality receive their perfected titles and proceed to have their names inscribed in the registers.

The Northern Gate is named the Northern Darkness Ultimate Cloud Gate, through which perfected ones who have committed transgressions are demoted to the ranks of the Lesser Sovereigns, and through which those studying the plain tablets pass.

Each of the four gates has two towers: the golden tower on the left, the jade tower on the right, both nine thousand *zhang* in height. The golden towers are supported by golden pillars, shaded by purple clouds, their surfaces inscribed with the names of the host of perfected ones and flying immortals. The jade towers are supported by azure jade pillars, shaded by green clouds, their surfaces inscribed with the names of the Supreme Perfected. All eight towers are thus.

Beneath the towers stand Azure Dragons and White Tigers to the left and right, celestial beasts and colossal serpents guarding the jade towers. Three hundred jade lads and jade maidens scatter incense among them. Atop the towers rise nine-tiered golden platforms, where the Void Sovereign’s Jade Dawn Commanding Immortal Lords reside.

The palace grounds span seven thousand *li* in circumference, with the Golden Gates Palace at its center. Within stand golden-hued purple halls, jasper chambers, and jade rooms, where the Latter Sage Golden Gates Emperor Lord dwells. Purple clouds shade above, green mists coil around the halls, sun and moon illuminate from either side, divine candles glow of themselves, golden perfected and jade maidens scatter incense in the empty courtyards, flowing light suffuses the Eight Mysteries, winds stir the dark banners, dancing pennants and canopies revolve, jade trees emit sounds, jasper branches murmur of their own accord, and a hundred harmonies arise in concert—this is the upper guesthouse of the Golden Gates, the passage through which the host of perfected ones travel.

The Four Poles Perfected Ones oversee those studying immortality, transmitting registers, advancing or demoting ranks, and all protocols for beginning students. All matters proceed through the Four Poles Perfected Ones.

**Protocol for Presenting Jade Tablets**

When one’s study of the Dao is complete, they proceed to the Eastern Florescence Azure Palace to verify their golden name. Afterward, they undergo a three-month purification fast, inscribe one jade tablet, and present themselves at the Golden Gates to pay homage to the Golden Gates Emperor Lord. The protocol requires that at the Cavern Treasure Rosy Cloud Gate, they prostrate and present the jade tablet. After a moment, upon receiving a response, they rise, bow twice to the Four Poles Perfected Ones, who then lead them forward to the base of the Golden Gates. They prostrate again between the golden tower on the left and the jade tower on the right. The perfected one leads them into the Purple Hall.

They proceed leftward, circling the Jade Radiance Golden Fusion Gate, then move southeast, ascending the palace steps to prostrate at the base of the hall. The Left Commanding Immortal Jade Gentleman, bearing the Purple Phoenix Vermilion Seal, Flying Jade Sentiments, Flying Azure Feather Canopy, Vermilion Brocade Flying Skirts, Tenfold Absolute Dragon Banners, causes them to ascend the Three Origins Palace. With flowing gold fire bells, jade tablets, and golden seals, they summon the thousand spirits, flowing clouds, dark rosy mists, and nine-dragon jade chariots to confer the title of Perfected Immortal, enabling flight through the Great Void and attendance at the chanting ceremonies. Once the matter is concluded, they rise, bow twice, and offer three bows of gratitude.

This is merely the conferral of the title; they have not yet been granted an audience with the Emperor Lord. Upon completion, they proceed directly to the base of the Northern Darkness Ultimate Cloud Gate’s golden tower, prostrate facing east, and declare: “Wandering Student Master Wang [Surname], having now received the title of Perfected Immortal from the Emperor Lord, is overwhelmed with joy and celebration. I humbly present myself at the tower to express gratitude and seek an audience with the Void Sovereign’s Jade Dawn Commanding Immortal Lord, to record my name in the Golden Gates and list it among the Perfected Immortals.”

They rise and bow twice, then proceed to the base of the Mystic Capital Jade Treasure Gate’s golden tower, prostrate facing south, and declare as above. Next, they proceed to the base of the Cavern Treasure Rosy Cloud Gate’s golden tower, prostrate facing west, and declare as above. Finally, they proceed to the base of the Jade Radiance Golden Fusion Gate’s golden tower, prostrate facing east, and declare as above.

After visiting the four gates and eight towers, they return outside the Jade Radiance Golden Fusion Gate, prostrate again, and bow twice. The Four Poles Perfected Ones then bestow upon them the golden tablet and jade seal. At that time, cloud chariots from the immortals of the Five Peaks shall naturally arrive to welcome them. They shall then be assigned a direction and entrusted with the governance of a sacred peak.

**Presenting at the Upper Clarity Golden Gates Palace before the Latter Sage Emperor Lord:**

[Your Peak] Master, Your Servant Wang [Your Surname], aged [Your Age], styled [Your Style].

**Golden Tablet Text:**
Inscribe one tablet and present it above.

This is the upper protocol for those who have attained the Dao, journeying to the Golden Gates to present tablets and receive their titles as Perfected Immortals from the Golden Gates Emperor Lord. The rites of homage and gratitude are treasured and concealed by the Emperor Lord, bestowed only upon those who have attained Perfection, not transmitted to the lower world.

Those who obtain the name of the Golden Gates Palace and the protocols for the golden tablets are recorded in the Inverted Golden Register and shall naturally ascend to the Golden Gates. The names of the Golden Gates Palace’s gates are all hidden names of the Nine Heavens, differing from the sounds of the earthly realm. Thus, the *Highest Void Sovereign Dao Lord’s Scripture on the Easy Possession* states: “In the northwest of the Nine Heavens above, the name is *Easy Possession*, three thousand five hundred *li* from the Mystic Capital Treasure Gate. Yet the *qi* of the Luminous Beam connects them, and the two gates communicate.”

chunks.original_text: 众真之所游，叙次之所关，既登易有之门、便上升帝堂，得谒玄景玉宝，便得进朝三元。 学者未登此门，宜知门名。 徒苦涉山林，绝志人间，而不知门户之所由，天真之仪格，何由得登金阙之宫。 夫存思之道，不知神名所在，神固不降。 欲登金阙上诣东华，不知其名格，宫因何登。 此乃出九天之上，秘於金阙之裹，知之者不死，得者飞仙，学者成真人。 世间不学之士，有知金阙宫名，天下三界称善，万神礼形，千妖丧目，而况於积学之家耶。 其道宝贵，不得轻传，非其人，殃及七祖，己身受考，无复仙冀矣。 真人披天关飞仙上法 天关者，是九天之生门也。 治在九天东南角，一名天图，一名天关，故为三关也。 众真之所经，神仙之所历，学者之由也。 其去金阙五千里，玉清上宫七千里。 得披三关，便得上登金阙，游宴玉清也。 第一天关，上有九层玉台，去地一千二百丈； 下有长蛇数千，飞龙毒兽备守玉关。 巨士三千人，皆备交金之领，夺牡门端。 太虚玉晨监，字虚上明，处在玉台之上，飞云流霞，夹映其房，日月玄照，光洞玉清，侍者真仙三百人，主上真出刘入开关所由。 第二天图，上有六层玉台，高九百丈：下有长蛇数千，飞龙毒兽备守玉关。 巨士三千人，皆备交金之领，夹门两端。 太上监真玉郎，字玄上伯，镇在玉台之上，丹云紫盖郁房，玄光偶月映其间，侍者真仙三百人，主卧众真游宴之所经。 第三天关，上有三层玉台，高六百丈； 下有长蛇数千，飞龙毒兽备守玉关。 巨士三千人，皆备交金领，夹卫两端。 太帝监真玉司郎，字无常生，领生玉台之上，玄云盖其上，虚烟馥其庭，自明之光焕其形，侍者真仙三百人，主上天众真、地下众真，簿录简籍所关由之。 凡受投金简玉名之道，当修披天关之法。 常当朝夕入室烧香，叩齿十二通，东向心拜四方，存思见九天之端，三关之下，历然分明。 都尽，次存七星在天之上，随运而转，我身在天关星上，七星运我身，至天关玉台之下，便投玉札一枚，奏名太虚玉晨监自通，见玉晨监以札记着玉格之上，通我身至天图之下。 次存我身还七星之上，七星运我至天图玉台之下，便投玉札一枚，奏上上直真玉郎前自通，见直真玉郎以札记着玉格之上，通我身在天关之下。 次存我身还七星之上，七星运我至天关玉台之下，便投玉札一枚，奏太帝监真玉司郎前自通，见断真玉司郎以札记着玉格之上，通我身至金关之下玉清之宫。 次存失去七星，身在空玄之上，溟涬之中，无所倚见。 须臾，觉在金阙玉景金融门之上，投金札一枚，见四极真人以玉案承札，入奏金阙帝君前。 四极真人报，与我俱登玉清之上。 次存玉清之上，四极溟然无崖，唯见青炁郁郁，仰亦无天，仰亦无地，唯见中央有金门四达，内有琼宫玉树，金枝夹生两边，巨龙走兽游戏其巅。 存我周游其间，良久，觉如睡眠，己远寝床，身中觉怳怳惚惚，如体蹈空。 存游洞都毕，便叩齿三十六通，仰天咒曰： 三华宝曜，玉都开明，玄晖敷陈，映监无形，金简绿字，克奏玉名，朗睹九天，上戏三清，天关三图，回登紫庭，金阙受号，东华记生，得乘八景，参御飞軿。 毕，咽炁九过止。 凡学之人，而不知披天之关，奏简记名之道，万亦无成也。

The assembly of perfected beings roam here, the sequence of their progression hinges upon this: once ascending through the Gate of *Easy Possession*, they then rise to the Emperor’s Hall, gaining audience with the Mystic Radiance Jade Treasure, and thus proceed to present themselves at the court of the Three Primes. Scholars who have not yet ascended this gate should know its name. In vain do they traverse mountains and forests, severing their ties to the human world, yet remain ignorant of the gate’s origin, the protocols of the Heavenly Perfected—how then may they ascend to the Golden Gates Palace?

In the practice of meditative visualization, if one does not know the name and location of the spirit, the spirit will certainly not descend. Those who wish to ascend the Golden Gates and journey to the Eastern Florescence must know its name and protocol—how else could they ascend the palace? This knowledge emerges from beyond the Nine Heavens, concealed within the Golden Gates. Those who know it shall not die; those who obtain it shall become flying immortals, and scholars shall attain the rank of Perfected Beings. Among the unlearned of the world, even those who know the name of the Golden Gates Palace are praised throughout the Three Realms, revered by the myriad spirits, and feared by the thousand demons—how much more so for those of cultivated learning?

This Dao is precious and must not be lightly transmitted. If imparted to the unworthy, calamity shall befall seven generations of ancestors, and the transgressor’s own person shall face tribulation, with no hope of attaining immortality.

**The Perfected One’s Method for Parting the Celestial Pass and Ascending as a Flying Immortal**

The Celestial Pass is the Gate of Life of the Nine Heavens. It governs the southeast corner of the Nine Heavens, also called the Celestial Chart or the Celestial Pass—thus, it is known as the Three Passes. It is the path traversed by the assembly of perfected beings, the course taken by divine immortals, and the route by which scholars ascend. It lies five thousand *li* from the Golden Gates and seven thousand *li* from the Jade Purity Upper Palace. Those who part the Three Passes may then ascend to the Golden Gates and wander in the feasts of Jade Purity.

The First Celestial Pass stands atop a nine-tiered jade terrace, rising one thousand two hundred *zhang* above the earth. Below, thousands of long serpents, flying dragons, and venomous beasts guard the Jade Pass. Three thousand mighty warriors, clad in interlocking golden armor, stand at the gates’ thresholds. The Grand Void Jade Dawn Overseer, whose name is *Void Upper Radiance*, resides upon the jade terrace. Flying clouds and flowing rosy mists flank his chamber; the sun and moon’s mysterious illumination penetrates the Jade Purity, casting light throughout. Three hundred perfected immortals attend him, overseeing the passage of the highest perfected beings as they enter and exit, opening the pass.

The Second Celestial Chart stands atop a six-tiered jade terrace, nine hundred *zhang* in height. Below, thousands of long serpents, flying dragons, and venomous beasts guard the Jade Pass. Three thousand mighty warriors, clad in interlocking golden armor, stand at either side of the gates. The Supreme Overseer of Perfected Jade Lords, whose name is *Mysterious Upper Elder*, presides upon the jade terrace. Cinnabar clouds and purple canopies shroud his chamber; the mysterious radiance of paired moons illumines the space. Three hundred perfected immortals attend him, overseeing the passage where the assembly of perfected beings gather and feast.

The Third Celestial Pass stands atop a three-tiered jade terrace, six hundred *zhang* in height. Below, thousands of long serpents, flying dragons, and venomous beasts guard the Jade Pass. Three thousand mighty warriors, clad in interlocking golden armor, stand guard at either side. The Supreme Thearch’s Overseer of Perfected Jade Officers, whose name is *Eternal Unchanging Life*, governs from the jade terrace. Dark clouds veil its summit; ethereal mists perfume its courtyard; the light of self-illumination gleams upon its form. Three hundred perfected immortals attend him, overseeing the registers and records of the perfected beings of the upper heavens and the earth below.

For those who receive the method of submitting golden tablets and jade names, they must cultivate the practice of parting the Celestial Passes. Regularly, at dawn and dusk, they should enter their chamber, burn incense, and strike their teeth twelve times. Facing east, they bow in reverence to the four directions, visualizing the boundaries of the Nine Heavens and the Three Passes below, each clearly distinct. When the vision is complete, they next visualize the Seven Stars in the heavens above, revolving in their course. Their own body stands upon the Celestial Pass Star, and the Seven Stars convey them to the base of the jade terrace of the Celestial Pass. There, they cast a jade tablet, submitting their name to the Grand Void Jade Dawn Overseer, who records it upon a jade register, permitting their passage to the base of the Celestial Chart.

Next, they visualize their body returning to the Seven Stars, which convey them to the base of the jade terrace of the Celestial Chart. There, they cast another jade tablet, submitting their name before the Supreme Overseer of Perfected Jade Lords, who records it upon a jade register, permitting their passage to the base of the Celestial Pass.

Then, they visualize their body returning once more to the Seven Stars, which convey them to the base of the jade terrace of the Celestial Pass. There, they cast a jade tablet, submitting their name before the Supreme Thearch’s Overseer of Perfected Jade Officers, who records it upon a jade register, permitting their passage to the base of the Golden Pass and the Jade Purity Palace.

Next, they visualize the Seven Stars vanishing, their body suspended in the boundless void, adrift in the primordial chaos, with nothing to rely upon. In an instant, they find themselves above the Golden Gates’ Jade Radiance Golden Fusion Gate, where they cast a golden tablet. The Four Poles Perfected Beings receive it upon a jade tray and present it before the Golden Gates Emperor Lord. The Four Poles Perfected Beings report back, ascending together with them to the Jade Purity above.

Then, they visualize the Jade Purity above, its four extremities boundless and without edge. Only a dense, verdant *qi* is visible; above, there is no heaven; below, there is no earth. They see only a central golden gate with four pathways, within which stands a jade palace and jade trees, golden branches growing on either side, with mighty dragons and beasts frolicking upon their peaks. They visualize themselves wandering among them for a long while, until they feel as if awakening from sleep, far from their bed, their body faint and indistinct, as if treading upon emptiness.

When their journey through the Grotto Metropolis is complete, they strike their teeth thirty-six times and, gazing upward, recite the incantation:

*"The Three Flowers’ precious radiance illumines the Jade Capital, revealing its brilliance;
The Mystic Splendor unfolds, casting light upon the formless.
Golden tablets with green characters perfectly submit the jade name,
Brightly beholding the Nine Heavens, ascending to sport in the Three Purities.
The Three Celestial Charts of the Celestial Passes are traversed, returning to the Purple Court;
The Golden Gates bestow a title, the Eastern Florescence records life.
Attaining the Eight Effulgences, they join the flight of the cloud chariot."*

When finished, they swallow *qi* nine times and cease.

For those who study yet do not know the method of parting the Celestial Passes or the way of submitting tablets and recording names, all their efforts shall come to naught.

chunks.original_text: 三关总统诸天诸地上真飞仙，及始学簿录，莫不经於三关者也。 凡积学之徒，能使九天三关有玉名，三关玉晨奏於太上大帝之宫，帝君自当遣玉童玉女各十二人，营卫子身。 此太帝之上篇，以传天帝君，天帝君以传南极上元君，南极上元君以传太微天帝君，太微天帝君以传金阙帝君，金阙帝君以传上相青童君，使教后学应为真人者。 依玄科，七百年内听得三出。 上元君以西华玉女九十人，卫在南极紫房之内。 青童君曰：有骨相应玄，得见此道，知有投简之法，便成真人。 但其科尤重、不得轻泄。 夫学者积亿，遇真者几人。 故中央黄老君云：得见《大洞真经三十九章》，便白日升天。 而有修之者，积年无成，便谓经之不真。 此皆坐由，东华无有金简之目，金阙无有玉札之名，真不为其降，而为天魔所乘，故有不感之效，徒得神经，万亦不成矣。 向使先奏金简於青宫，奉玉札於帝皇，得给金晨玉童、西华玉女，侍卫灵文，普下诸天诸地，三界称善，咏章万遍，岂不有致琼舆紫軿之感耶。 披三关投玉札升仙上文： 诣天关玉台太虚玉晨监几下。 某郡县乡里真人王甲，年如干岁，字某甲。 诣天图玉台太上直真玉郎几下，某郡县乡里真人王甲，年如干岁，字某甲。 诣天关玉台太帝监真玉司几下，某郡县乡里真人王甲，年如干岁，字某甲。 右书三玉札上，令长一尺六寸。 披金阙投玉札升仙上文： 诣金阙宫玉阙帝君几前，某郡县乡里真人王甲，年如干岁，字某甲，某月生。 右书玉札上，令长一尺六寸。 青童君云：无有金简者，银木亦可当，无有玉札者，桐木亦可当。 但令精好，直理无关节耳。 青童君曰：存披天关天图天关，上登青宫金阙玉清之道，当书玉札，先入室叩齿十二通，东向读札毕，仍备修存念之道毕，取札秘於云锦之囊，常烧香左右，不得轻露。 此上真之至号，玉郎之灵篇也。 若有金名玉字逆注青宫，得见此道，当依太真之科，赍金简、玉札各一枚，长一尺六寸，广二寸四分，金龙、玉鱼各一枚，紫缯百尺，青纹四十尺，以为太真之盟，奉有经之师。 师东向，受者北向，告北帝为盟，告七祖为誓，约不宣泄之信。 当依玄科，七百年内三传，传非其人，七玄之祖长充鬼役，身没九泉，万不得仙。 笃志之士，希仙之夫，当案科而奉真，依文而修焉。 洞真上清青要紫书金根众经卷下竟 #1『能书』二字上原缺三字。 #2此行原本错简，今移至此。 #3『之有知』三字原漏，据文义补。

The Three Passes govern all the heavens, all the earths, the perfected *zhenren* who ascend as flying immortals, and even the initial records of beginning students—none fail to pass through these Three Passes. For all who accumulate learning, if they can ensure their jade names are inscribed within the Nine Heavens’ Three Passes, and if the Jade Morning of the Three Passes submits to the Palace of the Supreme Great Emperor, then the Imperial Lord shall dispatch twelve jade lads and twelve jade maidens to guard and protect their person. This is the supreme scripture of the Supreme Emperor, transmitted to the Celestial Imperial Lord; the Celestial Imperial Lord transmitted it to the Upper Prime Lord of the Southern Culmen; the Upper Prime Lord of the Southern Culmen transmitted it to the Celestial Imperial Lord of the Grand Tenuity; the Celestial Imperial Lord of the Grand Tenuity transmitted it to the Imperial Lord of the Golden Gates; the Imperial Lord of the Golden Gates transmitted it to the Azure Lad, the Supreme Minister, instructing him to teach later students who are destined to become *zhenren*. According to the mysterious statutes, within seven hundred years, three transmissions are permitted.

The Upper Prime Lord commands ninety maidens of the Western Florescence to guard within the Purple Chamber of the Southern Culmen. The Azure Lad says: Those whose bone configurations align with the mysterious may behold this Dao, and knowing the method of submitting tablets, they shall become *zhenren*. Yet the statutes are exceedingly weighty, and it must not be lightly disclosed. Among the multitudes of scholars, how few encounter the true! Thus the Yellow Elder of the Central says: To behold the *Thirty-Nine Chapters of the Perfect Scripture of the Great Cavern* is to ascend to heaven in broad daylight. Yet some who cultivate it for years achieve nothing and then claim the scripture is not true. This is entirely due to the absence of a golden tablet’s entry in the Eastern Florescence and the lack of a jade slip’s name in the Golden Gates. The perfected do not descend for them, and they are instead ridden by celestial demons, thus failing to achieve resonance, merely obtaining spirit scriptures, and accomplishing nothing. Had they first submitted a golden tablet to the Azure Palace and presented a jade slip to the Imperial Sovereign, receiving the attendance of the Golden Morning’s jade lads and the Western Florescence’s jade maidens to guard the numinous text, with all heavens and earths universally approving, chanting the verses ten thousand times—would they not have evoked the response of jade chariots and purple carriages?

**Text for Parting the Three Passes and Submitting Jade Slips to Ascend as an Immortal:**

*At the Jade Terrace of the Celestial Pass, beneath the Jade Morning’s Supervisory Bureau:*
[Name of commandery, county, village, and hamlet], *zhenren* Wang [given name], aged [number] years, styled [courtesy name].

*At the Jade Terrace of the Celestial Chart, beneath the Jade Lad of the Supreme Direct Perfected:*
[Name of commandery, county, village, and hamlet], *zhenren* Wang [given name], aged [number] years, styled [courtesy name].

*At the Jade Terrace of the Celestial Pass, beneath the Jade Bureau of the Supreme Emperor’s Perfected:*
[Name of commandery, county, village, and hamlet], *zhenren* Wang [given name], aged [number] years, styled [courtesy name].

Write the above on three jade slips, each one foot and six inches in length.

**Text for Parting the Golden Gates and Submitting Jade Slips to Ascend as an Immortal:**

*Before the Imperial Lord of the Golden Gates Palace:*
[Name of commandery, county, village, and hamlet], *zhenren* Wang [given name], aged [number] years, styled [courtesy name], born in the [ordinal] month.

Write the above on a jade slip, one foot and six inches in length.

The Azure Lad says: If one lacks a golden tablet, silver or wood may suffice; if one lacks a jade slip, paulownia wood may suffice. Let them be refined and fine, with straight grain and no knots.

The Azure Lad says: When visualizing parting the Celestial Pass, the Celestial Chart, and the Celestial Pass to ascend the path to the Azure Palace, the Golden Gates, and the Jade Purity, one must inscribe the jade slip. First, enter the chamber, click the teeth twelve times, face east, and read the slip. Then, complete the method of cultivation, visualization, and contemplation. Place the slip in a cloud-brocade pouch, constantly burn incense beside it, and do not lightly reveal it. This is the supreme title of the highest perfected, the numinous scripture of the Jade Lads.

If one’s golden name and jade characters are retroactively inscribed in the Azure Palace and one beholds this Dao, they must follow the statutes of the Supreme Perfected. Prepare one golden tablet and one jade slip, each one foot and six inches long and two inches and four *fen* wide, along with one golden dragon and one jade fish. Use one hundred feet of purple silk and forty feet of green damask as the covenant of the Supreme Perfected, offering them to one’s master who possesses the scriptures. The master faces east, the recipient faces north, and they report to the Northern Emperor as a covenant, swearing to the Seven Ancestors as a pledge, vowing not to divulge the secret. According to the mysterious statutes, within seven hundred years, three transmissions are permitted. If transmitted to an unworthy person, the seven generations of ancestors shall be consigned to eternal ghostly servitude, the body shall perish in the Nine Springs, and immortality shall never be attained.

Those of steadfast resolve, those who aspire to immortality, must follow the statutes and serve the perfected, cultivating in accordance with the text.

Here ends the final scroll of the *Scriptures of the Golden Root of the Purple Writ of the Azure Essentials of the Highest Purity of the Great Cavern*.
